$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___tags.description: Key-value pairs of additional properties for the resource.

$eref.description: The sku determines the type of environment, either standard (S1 or S2) or long-term (L1). For standard environments the sku determines the capacity of the environment, the ingress rate, and the billing rate.

___capacity.description: The capacity of the sku. For standard environments, this value can be changed to support scale out of environments after they have been created.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___sku.description: The sku determines the type of environment, either standard (S1 or S2) or long-term (L1). For standard environments the sku determines the capacity of the environment, the ingress rate, and the billing rate.

$eref.description: Microsoft.TimeSeriesInsights/environments/accessPolicies

___name.description: Name of the reference data set.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___tags.description: Key-value pairs of additional properties for the resource.

$eref.description: Properties used to create a reference data set.

___dataStringComparisonBehavior.description: The reference data set key comparison behavior can be set using this property. By default, the value is 'Ordinal' - which means case sensitive key comparison will be performed while joining reference data with events or while adding new reference data. When 'OrdinalIgnoreCase' is set, case insensitive comparison will be used.

___keyProperties.description: The list of key properties for the reference data set.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___properties.description: Properties used to create a reference data set.

___tags.description: Key-value pairs of additional properties for the resource.

___description.description: An description of the access policy.

___roles.description: The list of roles the principal is assigned on the environment.

___principalObjectId.description: The objectId of the principal in Azure Active Directory.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

_88StandardEnvironmentCreateOrUpdatePara.description: Parameters supplied to the Create or Update Environment operation for a standard environment.

$eref.description: Properties used to create a standard environment.

___partitionKeyProperties.description: The list of event properties which will be used to partition data in the environment.

___dataRetentionTime.description: ISO8601 timespan specifying the minimum number of days the environment's events will be available for query.

___storageLimitExceededBehavior.description: The behavior the Time Series Insights service should take when the environment's capacity has been exceeded. If "PauseIngress" is specified, new events will not be read from the event source. If "PurgeOldData" is specified, new events will continue to be read and old events will be deleted from the environment. The default behavior is PurgeOldData.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___properties.description: Properties used to create a standard environment.

_88LongTermStorageConfigurationInput.description: The storage configuration provides the connection details that allows the Time Series Insights service to connect to the customer storage account that is used to store the environment's data.

___managementKey.description: The value of the management key that grants the Time Series Insights service write access to the storage account. This property is not shown in environment responses.

___accountName.description: The name of the storage account that will hold the environment's long term data.

_88EventHubEventSourceCreateOrUpdatePara.description: Parameters supplied to the Create or Update Event Source operation for an EventHub event source.

$eref.description: Properties of the EventHub event source that are required on create or update requests.

___eventHubName.description: The name of the event hub.

___keyName.description: The name of the SAS key that grants the Time Series Insights service access to the event hub. The shared access policies for this key must grant 'Listen' permissions to the event hub.

___sharedAccessKey.description: The value of the shared access key that grants the Time Series Insights service read access to the event hub. This property is not shown in event source responses.

___eventSourceResourceId.description: The resource id of the event source in Azure Resource Manager.

___serviceBusNamespace.description: The name of the service bus that contains the event hub.

___timestampPropertyName.description: The event property that will be used as the event source's timestamp. If a value isn't specified for timestampPropertyName, or if null or empty-string is specified, the event creation time will be used.

___consumerGroupName.description: The name of the event hub's consumer group that holds the partitions from which events will be read.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___properties.description: Properties of the EventHub event source that are required on create or update requests.

$eref.description: Parameters supplied to the Create or Update Event Source operation for an EventHub event source.

___properties.description: Properties of the EventHub event source that are required on create or update requests.

___properties.description: Properties of the IoTHub event source that are required on create or update requests.

___tags.description: Key-value pairs of additional properties for the resource.

_88LongTermEnvironmentCreationProperties.description: Properties used to create a long-term environment.

$eref.description: The storage configuration provides the connection details that allows the Time Series Insights service to connect to the customer storage account that is used to store the environment's data.

___managementKey.description: The value of the management key that grants the Time Series Insights service write access to the storage account. This property is not shown in environment responses.

___accountName.description: The name of the storage account that will hold the environment's long term data.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___storageConfiguration.description: The storage configuration provides the connection details that allows the Time Series Insights service to connect to the customer storage account that is used to store the environment's data.

$eref.description: The warm store configuration provides the details to create a warm store cache that will retain a copy of the environment's data available for faster query.

___dataRetention.description: ISO8601 timespan specifying the number of days the environment's events will be available for query from the warm store.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___warmStoreConfiguration.description: The warm store configuration provides the details to create a warm store cache that will retain a copy of the environment's data available for faster query.

$eref.description: The structure of the property that a time series id can have. An environment can have multiple such properties.
Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___timeSeriesIdProperties.description: The list of event properties which will be used to define the environment's time series id.

___description.description: An description of the access policy.

___roles.description: The list of roles the principal is assigned on the environment.

___principalObjectId.description: The objectId of the principal in Azure Active Directory.

_88ReferenceDataSetCreationProperties.description: Properties used to create a reference data set.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___dataStringComparisonBehavior.description: The reference data set key comparison behavior can be set using this property. By default, the value is 'Ordinal' - which means case sensitive key comparison will be performed while joining reference data with events or while adding new reference data. When 'OrdinalIgnoreCase' is set, case insensitive comparison will be used.

$eref.description: A key property for the reference data set. A reference data set can have multiple key properties.

___name.description: The name of the key property.

___type.description: The type of the key property.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___keyProperties.description: The list of key properties for the reference data set.

_88IoTHubEventSourceCreateOrUpdateParame.description: Parameters supplied to the Create or Update Event Source operation for an IoTHub event source.

$eref.description: Properties of the IoTHub event source that are required on create or update requests.

___keyName.description: The name of the Shared Access Policy key that grants the Time Series Insights service access to the iot hub. This shared access policy key must grant 'service connect' permissions to the iot hub.

___sharedAccessKey.description: The value of the Shared Access Policy key that grants the Time Series Insights service read access to the iot hub. This property is not shown in event source responses.

___eventSourceResourceId.description: The resource id of the event source in Azure Resource Manager.

___timestampPropertyName.description: The event property that will be used as the event source's timestamp. If a value isn't specified for timestampPropertyName, or if null or empty-string is specified, the event creation time will be used.

___consumerGroupName.description: The name of the iot hub's consumer group that holds the partitions from which events will be read.

___iotHubName.description: The name of the iot hub.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.

___storageLimitExceededBehavior.description: The behavior the Time Series Insights service should take when the environment's capacity has been exceeded. If "PauseIngress" is specified, new events will not be read from the event source. _88IoTHubEventSourceCreationProperties.description: Properties of the IoTHub event source that are required on create or update requests.

___keyName.description: The name of the Shared Access Policy key that grants the Time Series Insights service access to the iot hub. This shared access policy key must grant 'service connect' permissions to the iot hub.

___sharedAccessKey.description: The value of the Shared Access Policy key that grants the Time Series Insights service read access to the iot hub. This property is not shown in event source responses.

___eventSourceResourceId.description: The resource id of the event source in Azure Resource Manager.

___timestampPropertyName.description: The event property that will be used as the event source's timestamp. If a value isn't specified for timestampPropertyName, or if null or empty-string is specified, the event creation time will be used.

___consumerGroupName.description: The name of the iot hub's consumer group that holds the partitions from which events will be read.
